reference.shortdesc: An item group container element is a container used to sub-divide or organize elements that occur inside a list item, definition, or parameter definition.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The itemgroup element is particularly useful as a basis for specialization, where it can be used to group content within specialized list items or definitions. For example, in the OASIS task specialization, many elements within the step element are specialized from itemgroup.

example.title: Example
example.p: The following code sample shows how the itemgroup container can be used to subdivide a list item to create identifiable sections.
example.codeblock: • After getting in the bus, be sure to pay your fare. The fare allows you to ride all around the town.
